intro: Lomatium swingerae, commonly known as the mountain lomatium, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and umbel-like flower clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and its role in supporting local pollinators. Due to habitat loss, it is also considered a species of conservation concern in some regions.
